definitions:
(transitive) to sing, to say musically

Começarei cantando meu último sucesso, e então a próxima música será uma surpresa.

I will start singing my last hit, then the next song is a surprise.

(intransitive) to sing (express sounds musically through the voice)

Enquanto passava pelo jardim, pude ouvir um pássaro cantar.

While I was walking through the garden, I could hear a bird singing.

(transitive) to say with rhythm, chant

Enquanto tomava minhas medidas, ele cantava baixinho para si mesmo os números.

While taking my measures, he was chanting the numbers to himself in a soft voice.

(transitive, colloquial) to seduce by flattery

As únicas coisas que ele faz o dia todo são comer, dormir, e cantar meninas.

The only things he does all day are eat, sleep and seduce girls.
First-person singular (eu) future subjunctive of cantar
Third-person singular (ele, ela, also used with tu and você?) future subjunctive of cantar
First-person singular (eu) personal infinitive of cantar
Third-person singular (ele, ela, also used with tu and você?) personal infinitive of cantar
description: cantar (first-person singular present indicative canto, past participle cantado)
etymology: From Old Portuguese cantar, from Latin cantāre, present active infinitive of cantō, frequentative of canō, ultimately from Proto-Indo-European *keh₂n-.
